answers.answer: The two boils I've ever had were black in appearance, but when they popped, were bloody and ***** (sorry for the gross description).  I would think that the black would be old blood, maybe?  It is my understanding that infection would be green or yellow.  I'm no doctor though... I'm sure others will have better input.When you hear from the dr., will you let us know what he/she says?  I'm curious.

it is okay to apply warm compresses and topical antibiotic and be seen by a Dr. tomorrow.  There was no female Dr at the office we go to usually (females were off today w/my luck of course) and my son who is 8 has awful stomach virus and impossible unless emergency to get my daughter to the satellite office where there is a female physician (it is in the groin).  I was up 1/2 the night with him throwing up and other end, too (to be gross).  Just waiting to see who gets it NEXT >>> NO NO NO NO not me!If there is a fever or any other systemic symptoms to bring her right in for which I'll jump through hoops and make arrangements to get her there, of course.C~

My daughter used to get them in her groin area when she was a teenager.  The Dr had said they were caused by an ingrown hair.  We thought he was full of you know what,  but when opening one up, we saw a curley cue hair, sure enough!  She used to shave some there and the doc said to always use a new razor.  They were big and nasty and seemed to return in the same spot.  She's 29 now and hasn't had one for some years.  We'd do the warm compress thing and antibiotic ointment.Good luck with your daughter.

I don't have any answers, but wanted to offer my sympathy...I have only had one of those things and it was miserable! I remember I was about 13...it was very painful...seems like they are always in some..ahem awful spot! mine was on my behind! sheeesh...
She is fine .. it opened up and is doing much much better.  I bet it is from shaving and will mention about new razor, etc., etc.
